Tests

tests.overdisp(model, data)

Overdisp test for Statsmodels GLM Poisson model

tests.shapiro_francia(array)

The statistical test of Shapiro-Francia considers the squared correlation between the ordered sample values and the (approximated) expected ordered quantiles from the standard normal distribution. The p-value is computed from the formula given by Royston (1993). This function performs the Shapiro-Francia test for the composite hypothesis of normality, according to Thode Jr. (2002).

References: Royston, P. (1993). A pocket-calculator algorithm for the Shapiro-Francia test for non-normality: an application to medicine. Statistics in Medicine, 12, 181-184. Thode Jr., H. C. (2002). Testing for Normality. Marcel Dekker, New York.
